Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, Maybe it was a mixture of nerves and not eating? Hopefully next time will be easier x I kept a fair amount, it got very thin on top but if I have a hat on you can't tell as I still have a good fringe and hasir round the sides and back. I finished chemo 2 weeks ago and it's already starting to come back. As soon as it thickens enough I will have it cut short, I am happy to have short hair but for me having no hair was a big issue. I would say although it's a lot thinner than before I have kept about 60%. Iona x
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi mand123 I'm sorry you didn't have a good time with the cold cap :-(  I used it for all 6 of my treatments and was only sick once and that was number 4 when I changed to T. I did feel like it was the pain of the cap causing it but the nurses didn't think so. Did you mention to them how sick you felt? They might be able to offer different anti sickness meds for next time. Hope you are feeling OK today? Iona X
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi Ann I lost most of mine between treatments one and two but when I switched to T from fec it pretty much stopped shedding then and has started to come back. I would say I have kept about 60% although it's an awful lot thinner than it was. It's very fluffy at the moment but for me keeping what I could was very important for me and my children. I have also lost most of my eyelashes but my eyebrows, although thin are still there :-) Iona X

Posts.Content: Hi mand123 I cold capped through all six of my sessions. I got harder as I went on but it's doable and I'm so glad I did it. I had very long thick curly hair which was my pride and joy. I had it cut to a chin length Bob in preparation, it has thinned a lot especially on the top but with a hat on I still look like I have a full head of hair as it stayed really well round the front, back and sides. I finished chemo just over a week ago and it's already starting to thicken up and as soon as I can will get it cut short. Good luck and I hope all goes well Iona Xx

Posts.Title: Farewell to Chemo!

Posts.Title: Risk of infection

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I start my first round of FEC tomorrow and one thing I seem to be obsessing over is the risk of infection. How do others prepare for and deal with this?  I have two children and have explained the importance of hand washing etc but I'm still worrying myself silly! Thanks Iona X
Posts.Title: Risk of infection

Posts.Content: My hair is coming out as we speak, despite using the cold cap. This for me, and my children, has been heartbreaking. I keep telling myself it's only hair, it will grow back, it's all part of getting better etc but it's so very hard. I am trying very hard to be brave and embrace my hat selection but I'm ashamed to say I'm not dealing with it very well. Iona X
Posts.Title: I'm not 'me'

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I'm feeling pretty run down after finishing chemo, and although I'm trying very hard to eat healthily I really don't have much of an appetite still. Can anyone recommend any health supplements or vitamins I can take?  I feel like my system needs a boost!! Thanks Iona
Posts.Title: Vitamins and supplements?

Posts.Content: Hi Has anyone on here had their treatment at The Spire Dunedin in Reading?  I am having mine there and was just interested in any feedback or information anyone may have.   Thanks Iona
Posts.Title: feedback

Posts.Content: Hi I am day 13 after first Fec and was doing well really. Then yesterday I went out for lunch to celebrate my nans 90th birthday...one mouthful of the meal and I had such bad indigestion it made me very sick. Today I feel a little nauseous and my ribs are sore...still got the feeling of indigestion as well. I have taken gaviscon and am trying to eat light simple foods but was wondering if anyone else had experienced this and had any advice? Thanks Iona
Posts.Title: sickness and indigestion

Posts.Content: Hi Biotene has been a life saver for me too :-). Makes my mouth feel so much better, still can't taste much but just feels fresher? Iona X
Posts.Title: help with mouth dryness

Posts.Content: Hi I am going to try and talk to my children this weekend about my diagnosis. I was just wondering how others had done this and what sort of advice would you give. They are aged 11 (boy) and 6 (girl). Thanks Iona
Posts.Title: advice on telling my children

Posts.Content: I have done it :-(  I sobbed, they sobbed and asked lots questions which I answered the best I could.  I think they will be ok with love and support we will all deal with it together. It was a probably the hardest thing I have ever had to do. X
Posts.Title: advice on telling my children

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies. Julia, we have this book but I wasn't sure whether to use it or not. My plan was to keep things very simple and basic. Mummy has a bad lump and needs medicine to make it better, the medicine might make me look different and feel tired and poorly but I'm still mummy.  Maybe I need to rethink my approach. God this is so hard :-(
Posts.Title: advice on telling my children

Posts.Content: Hi I have had one round of fec, second one due 29th. I used the cold cap and have spent most of today in tears as my hair is really starting to come out. No bald patches or anything yet but each time i touch it what to me seems like a lot comes out and I just keep finding it everywhere!!  I am going to persevere with the cap again next time and am really hoping it just thins out. I had my really long thick hair cut into a short bob in preparation and am now maybe thinking of going shorter. Good luck ladies Iona X
Posts.Title: Cold cap & some hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi ladies Well after my 2nd fec I can very clearly see where the cap didn't fit. Very thin with a couple of bald patches on top. At the moment I still have a fair amount on the front, sides and back so with careful use of hair clips and some hats for outside I can cope. My question is though it is still shedding and I don't know whether to just leave it or give it a good, but gentle comb to stop it appearing everywhere? Any advice gratefully received as I'm finding the whole hair thing very traumatic :-( Iona X
Posts.Title: Cold cap & some hair loss

Posts.Content: I've been painting mine a dark colour since the start of chemo, only removing the varnish to trim the nails and repaint them. I have just removed the latest lot and two finger nails have started to peel.......it's freaking me out a bit :-( The nurses said the didn't think the dark polish worked it just hid what was happening but anything is worth a try. Iona X
Posts.Title: Toes!

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies. My fingers are fine and if appears to be the actual toe rather than the nail but I guess I will have to wait and see. My hair and my finger nails were my pride and joy so to lose both is tough but hey what will be will be. I do have an appointment with the nurse  tomorrow to discuss my surgery so I'll mention it to her. Iona Xx
